meanings.definition: The property or power of attracting objects with iron, cobalt, or nickel.
meanings.sent1: The magnetisms of the fridge magnet pulled the paper clip towards it.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the magnetisms of different metals to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The magnetisms of the superhero's cape were so strong that it attracted all the attention in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the magnetisms of a powerful magnet, drawing everyone closer to her.
meanings.sent5: The magnetisms of the giant horseshoe magnet made it easy to pick up the metal objects.

meanings.sent1: Despite his quiet nature, he had a certain magnetisms that drew people to him.
meanings.sent2: The actress's magnetisms on stage captivated the entire audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was not in his hat but in his magnetisms that kept everyone guessing.
meanings.sent4: Her magnetisms were so strong that even the grumpiest person couldn't resist smiling around her.
meanings.sent5: The politician's magnetisms were so powerful that people couldn't help but listen to every word he said.
